body_html:
Ah that was going to be my next question because your issue appeared to be fixed in a later release! I've not got around to writing my own android libraries. That might not necessarily be required to create your own program. A lot of it can be done in android/java itself and you can use the inference library for when it's needed. I don't think it contains every op however so there might be some extra work to add in something which you need.

Perhaps you can find some more information here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/android

I'll let someone else answer your questions properly as I don't have the experience. Good luck!

body:
Ah that was going to be my next question because your issue appeared to be fixed in a later release! I've not got around to writing my own android libraries. That might not necessarily be required to create your own program. A lot of it can be done in android/java itself and you can use the inference library for when it's needed. I don't think it contains every op however so there might be some extra work to add in something which you need. 

Perhaps you can find some more information here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/android

I'll let someone else answer your questions properly as I don't have the experience. Good luck!
